Speaker: revised draft
Dialogue: September 8, 1987

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Burritos...Enchiladas...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Oh, gag, man, how can you eat that stuff?...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: I can't wait for fresh vegetables...

Speaker: willie's voice
Dialogue: Six to Shack.  I'm the hook.

Speaker: sixpack's voice
Dialogue: Hey, Willie, you trip on a tit or something?  We're all waiting on you, honey.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Keep your pants on Sixpack. I promise you'll be inside before "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood" comes on.

Speaker: willie's voice
Dialogue: Six to Shack...Hook's on.  Ready to winch.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: When it's time to relax.... One thing stands clear...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: ...beer after beer...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Jonesy!  I'm losing compression... I'm going to blow my suit, man! Beck!  Doc!  Help me!...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Give me a readout, DeJesus.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: He don't need a readout, man, he needs help!

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Calm!?  Where's Doc?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: The internal monitors read normal.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Where's Doc?!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Oh, mother of Jesus, forgive me of my--

Speaker: beck's voice
Dialogue: Get him into the Shack.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: I'm telling you, it's the suits!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck the suits, it's the people monitoring them.  It Doc had been there like he's supposed to it never would've happened!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: And just what the fuck would he have done to stop it, huh?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: I know all about implosion, man.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Yeah, I bet you do.  Jonesy!  Doc!...Help me!  Help me!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Knock it off, Sixpack!  I know it's been a long month for every- one, but we can't let something like this tear us apart...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Shit...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck the suits man...this place is going to kill us first.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Two more days.  I tell myself 'you can make it two more days--'

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: What's the weather like up top?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Clear for pickup.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Let's hope it holds.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Then what?  Huh?  Then what?  You folks think going up top's the answer to all your problems.  Well, it ain't.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Give us a break, Cobb...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: A break?  You folks don't need a break, you need psychiatrists.  'Know what you'd be doing if you were up there, right now?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Eating pussy and drinking brew...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Eating pussy my ass.  What about lines at the bank:  What about getting stuck in traffic?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Wherever I can find it.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Bullshit!  I'll tell you what you'd be doing!  You'd be watching news on TV that's so fucking bad it makes you nauseous.  So you go out and get in your car to get some fresh air and after you've been driving for five minutes you realize the air's so damn dirty you don't dare breath it!  That's what you've got to look forward to...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Doc eat already?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The good doctor hasn't showed yet.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: How do you feel, DeJesus?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Better let the Doc take a look at you, after dinner.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Yeah, since he was busy earlier when you needed him.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Cut it, Sixpack.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: 'Makes me feel better already...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I've been looking at the duty roster...at the shack hours outstanding...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Uh, oh...I see where this is going...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: ...all of you owe time and I thought tonight would be a good time to---

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No way, Mister Beck!  No fucking way!  We just did a full shift, you can't call Shack duty on top of a full shift.  It's a contract violation!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Whooo!  Right on, Cobb!  Let's hear it for our shop Steward!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Hear that Becky, er, Mr. Beck? Company got to abide by the rules.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I know all about the contract. The point is you can follow the goddamn contract to the letter and pull your shack duty tomorrow...or you can get it done tonight and call tomorrow a down day.  It's up to you.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: You giving us a day off?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What about our quota?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: You're only twenty-five tons off quota.  Barring an unforeseen problem you should reach it easily on the last day.  It's just a day off.  You don't have to take it, I just thought it might help.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Count me in.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Cobb, Jones, I want you to do something about that damn rattle in the air system...  Bowman and Sixpack...living quarters...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Shit...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Williams...get DeJesus' suit on the "sick rack" and do a diagnostics.  Any other suit problems she should know about?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: My pocket.  Check my pocket, will ya, honey?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Your pocket?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: The latch is screwed up.  Or the hinge.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You did good...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Today...with DeJesus.  That was smart thinking to get him inside...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: There probably wasn't anything wrong with his suit...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Still...you did the right thing.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I must have dozed off.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Are you planning on working tomorrow?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Well, I'll be on the golf course in the morning.  Then, if I don't have any babies to deliver--

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: We almost had an accident today. DeJesus' suit...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You got something to say to me, son?...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I...I think it's important to have the second officer on deck.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'll keep it to nine holes in the morning.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Christ...what a pair...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: What was that?  What'd you say?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: I said, "What a pair" the boy wonder Shack Boss and his drunken doctor buddy make...  Why?  What did ya think I said?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Listen to it for Christsake.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Ah, it's just old, like me. You don't see the Doc opening me up every time I get a new creak in my joints...I say, as long as it's recycling the air let the next shift deal with it. But, 'long as we're here...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Two hundred and fifty-two tons of Magnesium and 15 tons of Sodium.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Sounds like a good week, Beck. In fact...I put your folder in front of the Vice President of District Operations last night...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Thank you, Martin.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Don't thank me, yet, but it is important to know where you're going and who your friends are... 'Know what I mean?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Probably a short.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Okay, watch this..

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: So that's all you do?...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Shhhh...don't tell no one.  Job security.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Nothing wrong with this...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: This is Beck.  Is there a problem, Williams?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: A little problem, sir...but I've got a handle on it now.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Made your million, yet?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: How's TransOcean doing?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: You got money in this tub?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: I signed-up for the stock option.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Hey, man, you know that in Switzerland--and this country's the size of East L.A., okay?--they speak 54 different dialects? Fifty-four!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Who cares?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: I do, man.  That's a beautiful place.  When I get out of here I'm going there.  Find a nice little snow covered chalet, warm little woman, crackling fire--

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Hey, Cobb...Man, why don't you take off your shirt and pants, man?  You should do that wearing what you're going to wear at the beach.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: This is what I wear at the beach, goddamnit.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: That sounds interesting, but they're too tied to their holdings.  Remember a year ago when they lost that tanker?... The bottom fell out of their stock and I lost a bloody fortune.  That's when I decided to diversify.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You take your money, too seriously, Bo.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: You're damn right I do.  Five years down here and I'll pull in more than 15 topside.  I'm not down here for the fun, I'll tell you that.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Get out of here, Sixpack.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: I got a date with an angel...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, Bo...when're you going to be off that thing?  I want to find out tonight's NBA scores and check the weather.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: The weather's good, I already checked, but I'll be off in a minute.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Hey, Jonesy, who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Jameson?  Who're you trying to con?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, Hazy!  We got a day off tomorrow, Kemosabi!  Let's get shit-faced!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: No, man, Cobb is a Chivas drinker, from way back.  Ain't that right Cobbie?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You guys are crazy.  What the hell you play that stupid game for?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: What game, Cobb?...I'm on my way to Nirvana...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You're on your way somewhere all right...the looney bin.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: I'm on the way to the looney bin?  Hey, man, I'm not the dude sun bathing in his clothes.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Oh, Darlin'...come sit on my face...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: That bitch!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Bitch!  Look what you did!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Sorry, darling...Just thought a little humor would loosen us all up...you know?...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: You think you're so funny? Wait till you taste this!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Look at my foot, sir!  This bitch put a goddamn sea monster in my bunk!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: How do you know it was Williams?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Huh?  I...uh...uh...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: All right, Sixpack, you and Williams are gonna pull water duty tomorrow--

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: At ease!  You both have a half day...Anymore shit and its a full one.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Oooooh.  Damn!  Not so loud. Turn down the music.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What music?  There ain't no music.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Oooooh.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You know it's really crazy to pretend to be drunk, but it's fucking insane to pretend to have a hangover.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: "No goddamn boy is going to make me go out on a down day."

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Yeah?  How'd the kid hold up?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Pretty good.  He sent them out videotaping outcrop.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Charge set?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I need more light on that, Four.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: More light, Sixpack...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Boo!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You shit....

Speaker: beck's voice
Dialogue: What's going on, Four?  What's happening?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: We're fine, Shack.  His lights malfunctioned for a minute.  How's this?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: That's great.  Now let's move 35 degrees southwest.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You screw around like that again and--

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: What's wrong, did you miss me?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Hardly.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Don't worry, darlin, I'm...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What's wrong?!  What happened?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Sixpack?!  Sixpack...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: He's gone.  I think he's fallen.  I'm going down after him.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: That's it Jonesy...Sweat it out, man...Got to get the poison out of our blood.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Sixpack is lost.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Weren't they tied?  They're supposed to be tied.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: How far away is she?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Two hundred meters.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: My God, look at the size of those tubers....

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Nine, ten feet high...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: If he had his blinkers on--

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: It wouldn't make any difference in there...He could be two feet away and on fire and she'd still not see him!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Sixpack?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Why can't we pick up his signal?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Maybe he got eaten?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: What would be dumb enough to eat Sixpack?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Affirmative...Widening picture.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What the?...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Russian.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What's your air reading?

Speaker: willie's voice
Dialogue: Twenty minutes...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Twenty minutes!...Who had tank duty?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Who else...Sixpack.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The man is unbelievable... I say, leave him in there.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: What about his suit?  That's a million five the company's got to replace.  They'll make somebody go get it.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Willie, we're giving you five minutes...after that we're coming in.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Sixpack?...Answer me.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: I'm rich, honey.  Rich!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: It's all mine if I'm on report. Otherwise you gotta take me off report before you look at any more... Ain't that right, Cobbie?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You're on your own, Sixpack, you fucked up everybody's day off...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Personal effects...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Timex...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Russian money...Don't look like much.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Yeah, I'd say you can retire with all this loot.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hell, it's in Russian.  I can't read it...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: May I see it?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Vodka.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What assholes, they lock booze in the safe.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Probably confiscated.  No booze on board, same as us.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Stolichnaya.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You read Russian?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Russian, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German, a little Hindu, some Serbo Croat and a smattering of Swahili...standard pre-med background...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Bullshit.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: ...and a Russian grandmother...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I want all this stuff impounded in the supply safe.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You mind if I take a look at this?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Be my guest.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: You got 'em!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: What good's the kid's med records anyway!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Watch and learn, amigo...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What do you want me to say? That it all sounds mysterious?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: These observers were doing something. A test...I think they sank that ship on purpose to cover up their mistakes.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What mistakes?  Look, I think it's no big deal but if you want to find out why this ship sank have Maritime run a check.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I did.  They have no record of the wreck.  The Marshal Goloviev is now on a tour in the Baltic Sea.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: It's not the phone number...

Speaker: bowman's voice
Dialogue: Okay, try the social security number...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Okay, give it to me...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Two...twelve...ninety-six.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: You guys are so full of shit... Who's going to use their birthday...

Speaker: dejesus voice
Dialogue: BINGO!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Like I said, that bottle's mine!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I want your permission to check that vodka.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: This is a mining shack, not a lab, Doc.  If there's something strange with the vodka it's safe till we get back.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Beck's coming.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Something wrong, Cobb?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Uh..Excuse me sir, it's the air recirculating system, sir...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What's wrong with it?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: ...I'd really have to show it to you.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: All right...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Something wrong?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Cute, DeJesus...Specimen cups?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Aw, loosen up, Bowman...  Hey, Willie, I got one served up for you.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: No, thanks.  I've got my blood tests in three days.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: That's all you do is exercise. You got to learn to live a little.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: After my astronaut training physical, then I'll tie one on.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Forget space cadet, I'll drink hers.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Hey what happens it he goes back and finds the bottle missing?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: He won't...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Shit!  It's water!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Beck switched it!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Can you beat that?  The sonof- abitch doesn't trust us!

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: That little turd.  If I ever get the chance I'll fix his ass.

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Didn't I ever tell you vodka was my favorite drink?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: That was a loud one wasn't it?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: After a month of it you'd think I'd be used to it.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: How's astronaut training?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Why?  You going to give me hard time like the others?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No.  I'm just being friendly.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Good...It's going good.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Whatever made you want to do a tour down here?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: I need electrical field experience on my resume. Everything helps...  Why are you here?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Everybody in corporate training serves a tour on the line.  Sup- posed to hone leadership skills or something.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Has it helped?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: I guess there's not a lot of adventure in the Control Room.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: You think I should hang around more with the crew?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Well, I always heard you don't "learn" leadership, you earn it.  How did you know they'd get into the vodka?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I guess I figured if I was in their shoes that's what I would've done.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Maybe you're more one of us than you think...sir.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Puuleeeeze...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Hey, Sixpack...Rise and shine amigo...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Let's see your tongue.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Pretty good imitation of a hangover and I ought to know.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Well, it ain't!  It feels a thousand times worse.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: I...I dunno.  I just feel... wrong.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Take off your shirt.

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Shit, Doc...I didn't know I had them.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: ...as long as you know it's not in your contract.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I know that.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Well, suit yourself, then...its your decision...  Ha ha...a little joke...suit yourself...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: How's the weather for pickup tomorrow?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Beautiful.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Bad as he is there's no way we can make our quota with- out his sad self out there. You just can't do it.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: He's tanking on us...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: No...he's really sick.  I heard him last night.  The company will take that into consideration...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Honey, the company don't give a flying fuck about "whys," they just look at the numbers and the contract says if we miss our quota they only got to pay us half-pay for the entire month.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: 'Cocksucker's tanking on us...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No, he's really sick...He won't be going out today.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: There goes our quota...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Thirty days, right down the toilet...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Is this a contract violation, Mr. Cobb?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No sir...I just wanted to know if you needed a hand?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Thanks...

Speaker: sixpack
Dialogue: Please, Doc...I'm cold...I hurt...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm just going to take a tiny piece of skin to look at under the microscope...Afterwards I'll give you a sedative.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Okay, number 23's full.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Let's get it out of here and bring in a new one.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Yes sir...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Let's have her...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: No kidding?  "A virus of unknown origin."  Come on and tell me something I don't know... like what's going on...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Good work out there, Mr. Becky.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Dead?  This morning you said he had some skin disorder.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: He did.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Well, how the hell does a skin rash kill you in eight hours?!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Here.  Put this on.  You examine him.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I'm not a doctor.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: For this...you don't need to be.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: The mask is because you think it might be...catching?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I don't know.  I've been back and forth with Narragansett Naval all day, consulting with the best people in maritime medicine, the best people in viruses...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: And?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: And they didn't believe the symptoms I described...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Why Sixpack?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It could be a million things, something in the air, food....  I want to examine the crew.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Yeah...right...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I've reported the death to the company.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: "Routine," my ass!  Ain't nothin' "routine" about no physical check- up 10,000 feet down...especially when we're getting picked up the next day!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: He didn't say it was a "routine check-up," he said it was a "routine precaution."

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Must be bad.  Even sick Sixpack never missed a meal.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: It's this fucking air system....

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Ain't the food or the air system, he's just sick... Everybody gets sick every now and then.  It's all part of being human!

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Well, I must be human because I'm sure as hell sick.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Christ, it'd be a hell of a thing if I went back to the roof with some kind of herpes thing.  My wife wouldn't understand that at all...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You seem all right.

Speaker: cobs
Dialogue: She wouldn't understand.  She'd think I was down here fucking my head off.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: How come you're wearing those gloves?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Not yet.  You got any ideas?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You don't think it was from going on that ship do you?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: That's a possibility.  But if it was that simple why haven't the symptoms begun on you?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You mean I'm okay?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You're fine.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It blackens...becomes scaly.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: You mean like a fish?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Yes...like a fish...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: I was just joking, Doc.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Well, according to Maritime law, you, as commander of the Shack have the authority to dispose of the body.  However, the company doesn't want you to do that.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What you don't understand is that my crew is in jeopardy.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But you don't have any proof at this point to assume that this disease is contagious, do you?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I'm not anxious to find out, either.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Beck, trust me.  If the company felt that you or your crew were in any danger we would authorize an immediate emergency pickup. We could be there in a few hours.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Unfortunately.  We can't.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What're you saying?  That we're not even going to be picked up tomorrow?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: It shouldn't be a long delay.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: But it's a delay!  How long? A day?  Two days?!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Twelve hours, no big deal.  We should know something first thing in the morning.  Don't worry.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Bo?  Doc says you're next.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, Sixpack...Hey, my man... How you feeling?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, man, we made quota to- day.  No thanks to you, you dog, but we made it...Beck helped us...We just dropped Bowman off.  I hope what you've got ain't catching...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Who were you talking to?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Sixpack...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: How is he?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Sleeping.  No sign of Doc, though.  I'll check the control room.  You look in the shower room...

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Oh, God...what's going on?

Speaker: bowman
Dialogue: Sixpack...what's going on?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You have to call them back. Explain that this is an emergency.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir...Bowman's sick.  She's downstairs in the infirmary.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: The infirmary?...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Yes sir, ain't that where we usually go when we're sick?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: We're simply concerned about her...proximity to...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Sixpack's dead.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Bullshit...I was just talking to him.  I saw him move.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What?...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I left her here.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Bowman?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Bowman.  It's Doc.  I'm here to help you.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I can't tell you much about it, except that none of you show any symptoms.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: And it killed Bo?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No...she killed herself.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: We're getting out of here just in time.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: There's now a problem with the weather for pickup.  There's a typhoon in our sector... ...We're going to be delayed twelve hours...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Typhoon?!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Twelve hours!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: At least we get time and a half.  That's in the contract.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck double pay, man!  I want out of here!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Stay here.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: C'mon, Cobb...you're slacking...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I ain't, goddamnit...It's Jones!..

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Shut up, all of you.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Mr. Beck, the contract states that no body can be disposed of without authorization of---

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck the contract, man!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Hey!...I feel something. It's moving!  He's alive!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I feel it, too...Someone's trying to get out.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Cobb, what're you doing!

Speaker: cobs
Dialogue: But he ain't dead!  He ain't dead.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Cobb!  Stop!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It bit me!  It bit me!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Push Hazy!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus Christ!  I ain't never gonna sleep again!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It bit me!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: It's Sixpack!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I'm going to kill it!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Close the Lock!  Now!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I think we just found our problem.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Serves his ass right to get it.  Motherfucker brings that shit onboard.  I hope his fucking ass rots in the sea and is shit upon by the fish.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: 'Fucker could have gotten us all killed.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: He knew better than that.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You guys sure weren't so holy when you were shooting that vodka...It could have been you.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Hold it!  Rewind it.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Stop it.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Back it up slowly.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: There.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: You know that Innsbruck has 64 square miles of ski slopes, man?  Think about that. Sixty-four square miles.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: How'd you do that?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: What?  That?...I've done this one before.  You hungry?  I'm hungry.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hungry?  After what we just went through I may never eat again.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: They found this?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: No.  I think they isolated him in genetic engineering. Homo aquaticus...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Was there such a thing?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Danakil man?...one of our ancestors.  Named for the Danakil Alps in Ethiopia.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Not exactly a big ocean country.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It was when it counted a couple of million years ago when the seas came in and drove us into the water.  Most homo sapiens didn't make it...Danakil man... adapted.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Some say that's why we're basically hairless, for less water resistance, faster swimming speeds...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: But what about those scales... or that leech-like thing that bit Cobb?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Why stop with just one aspect of marine life?  Why not incorporate the best genetic components the ocean has to offer?...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Well, if they were perfecting an aquaman, then why's there a dead one onboard that Russian ship?  Why isn't he out swimming around?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: He obviously lacked something in his environment.

Speaker: jones' voice
Dialogue: Turned black yet?

Speaker: cobs
Dialogue: That ain't funny.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Relax, Cobb.  If it was going to turn, it would have done its trick by now.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: That's easy for you to say. You ain't the one that got bit.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Don't tell me you're getting soft on us, Cobbie?  You're the fellow who always said--

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Nothing's changed, goddamnit!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Man, everybody is jumpy... What are you doing?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Getting some food.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Under there?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Look.  Water.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Probably the plumbing.  You gonna make me finish that puzzle by myself, or what?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: No, I'll be right there.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Mustard.  Need mustard...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Sixpack...

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Ahhh!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, Hazy...what're you doing now...cooking?

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Help me, Jonesy.  Oh, God, help me!  It's getting inside me, I can feel it!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hazy, please...I'm going to get you some help, man...just don't touch me...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: It's Hazy...It's got him! Stay here and don't let him out.  I'm going to get the Doc.

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Help me!  Help me!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: It's got Hazy!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What has?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: One of those chunks of Sixpack!  Like a big leech, with those teeth!...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: We've got to get him to the infirmary.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: What are you going to do to him?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm going to try to remove it.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I've got Cobbie downstairs watching the door.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Cobb?  Hazy?  Oh, shit...He's gone...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: You let him get away!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I ain't doing nothing for that thing without something to defend myself.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: That thing happens to be my friend.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Shut up, both of you!  We've got to find it.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Oh, God, she's out there...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Jones...come with me.  Cobb, you and Doc check the rooms.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Willie...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What on earth's the matter with you?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I ought to smack your face!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: DeJesus...It's got him.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I thought they were your friends?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Were, Doss were.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: You fire that in here and you'll bring the whole place down.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Jones to Doc.  Doc?...Cobb?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No, it's not going through. The intercom's busted.  I thought DeJesus fixed that?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: He did.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It...almost got you.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What was it?

Speaker: cobs
Dialogue: I saw it!  It's big!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Big?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Bigger than DeJesus?  How?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It's had a meal.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: It needs blood?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fucking great...You telling me we got a fucking dracula in here with us?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It would explain the suction- like appendages.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Like a leech.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: That's why there's a dead one on the ship.  It ran out of blood.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: What dead one on the ship?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: The monster appears to be a genetic aberration...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: No fuckin' lie...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: ...It has many traits of deep sea marine life...regeneration, scales, gills, even a period of dormancy...  but the fact that it remembered where the plasma was stored, or where the communication wiring was, may imply that it has some other quality...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What?...What?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: That it acquires intelligence from its victims?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Intelligence may not be the right word...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck semantics, Doc! You saying its like part DeJesus, part Sixpack, part Bowman?!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I don't know.  I'm guessing.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I say we should go get in the escape bubbles and get the hell out of here!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: And hit the surface in the middle of a typhoon?...No, thank you. I'll take my chance down here.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What can we do?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Our only chance is to lure it to the Swamp and flush it like we did the other.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: And how're we going to do that?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Be careful with it.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Don't worry, I don't want to give up any more.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Still bothering you?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Itches like hell.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Take it off and let me have a look.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Looks good to me.  I'll re-bandage it, though.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You can't go out there alone.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm the Doctor.  I have to do what's best for this crew.  I need my bag.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: There, good as new.  Just keep your paws off of it.  Do you have the new bandage ready?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Doc?...Doc!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I hear something. Don't fire until we're both in the Swamp.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Don't worry...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: C'mon baby c'mon...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Oh God...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Run Willie!  Run!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Well done.  Just like momma makes 'em.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Where's Cobb and Doc?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Cobb's cut...It was in him! It got Doc...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Oh man, that's just great...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: C'mon.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Lock the door.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Shit!  He sent them all.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: The escape bubbles?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Look at this.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The good doctor signed our death warrant.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Well, at least we're safe inside here.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: For how long?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Thank goodness, you're still alive!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Hey, man, you better get your ass out here right now and get us.  You hear me, motherfucker?  Right now!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Please relax, Mr. Jones.  Every- thing is under control.  Naturally, when we received Dr. Warren's message we were concerned but would never have deserted you.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: When are you coming for us?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Right now it is on a course--

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Just answer the question, man! When are you coming?!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Hopefully in the next 48 hours.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Forty-eight hours!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I realize you must have gone through hell--

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Gone?  Man, we're still here!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I can't change the weather. Try to get some rest.  I'll keep you posted.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: He's right.  Why don't you get some rest.  I'll stand the first watch.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Martin, you asshole...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: They know, don't they?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Yeah...I think they're just deciding what to do with us.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Maybe they already have.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Seeing how my stock's doing...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Where?....

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I can't believe they'd just leave us.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Welcome to the union, boss. We're all expendable.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The air's stopped.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: We're on backup air.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: How much time does that give us?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Less than an hour.  It's ruptured an air duct.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Can't we fix it?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: There're twenty miles of pipe in the bilge, they could have tapped-in anywhere.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Cobb...Job security...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: They're drawing us out.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You can't go out there, that's what they want.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: We don't have much choice... without air, the internal pressure will fall and--

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Crunch...Implosion.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: You don't think I'm sitting in here, do you?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: The shack...

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: She's wondering what's happening.  We're losing air faster than I thought.

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Which way?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I'll go first.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Don't spend all day down there.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Don't fuckin' worry, I ain't.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: "Off we go...into the wild blue yonder..."

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Jesus Christ...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Can you fix it?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: No way...

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Think!  Can we stop it?! Block it up?!  Shut down the line somewhere?!  Think!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I am thinking, man!  You think I want to die!  I am thinking!  I--

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I hit it.  But I can't see it!  Can you see it?!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The Swamp.  There's an over- ride switch in the Swamp.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Ahhh!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Hurry...Get out!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Jones!  Get your feet out of the water!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: C'mon, the Swamp!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Beck!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Go on!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: That's an order!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Fuck your orders!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: It's jammed!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Where the hell've you been?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I got hung up!  Try this!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: It won't go!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: The suits!  Get in them!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: The suits!  Are you crazy! How're we going to get to the surface?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Like this.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Your suit, Becky!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Just get in yours!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Go, now!  That's an order!

Speaker: dejesus
Dialogue: Kill me...Kill me!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: We made it!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Where's Jones?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Is he okay?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: What happened to that typhoon?

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Are you sure you saw something?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: How many times I got to tell you.  I saw a ship.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Well, why haven't they answered our flares?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: We'll fire one more, that leaves us one last one.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Are you okay, Jonesy?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Tip top, Willie...tip top.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: Who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Jameson?  Who are you trying to con...?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I'll be damned.  Look!...A flare!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: It saw us!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Answer them and quit kicking me!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: I'm not touching you!

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: No...no, no, no.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: I thought you said you'd combed this area?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: We did....Many times.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Initiate rescue.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: It hit me!  Where are they?!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I can't see them!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: All right!  I've had enough of this shit!  You want meat, motherfucker?  Come on, eat me, sucker, try some dark meat!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Jonesy...Give me your hand!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: C'mon, Jones!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Jonesy, No!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Get out of here, Becky!

Speaker: winch operator
Dialogue: Is he in the harness!

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: C'mon, motherfucker open up!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Mr. Beck, I understand you passed your physical with flying colors.  And Ms. Williams?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: I don't know yet, she's still in there.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Well, you'll be glad to know you have a friend onboard.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: So, how are you feeling?

Speaker: beck
Dialogue: Better...A lot better.

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: I'm fine!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: I thought we might have some wonderful seafood.  But, if there's something else you'd rather have...

Speaker: willie
Dialogue: How about a burger and fries?
